nodes.text: The Crippling scope was a type of scope that increased the effectiveness of blasters, blaster rifles, and bowcasters by allowing the user to focus more precisely on the target, resulting in a considerable chance of incapacitating the target. These scopes offered better magnification, meaning that even the humblest of blaster pistols could theoretically be made into a sniping weapon. The Mark I, II, & III scopes in turn allowed for increasingly significant boosts in accuracy over longer ranges.
